rules: Headings must be dark (Slate-900) or Primary Blue.
Body text must never be lighter than Slate-600 for accessibility.

primary.description: Deep Royal Blue - Authority, Trust, Clarity

accent.description: Signal Orange - Action, Urgency, High Visibility

usage_rules: Backgrounds should be 'Tinted White' (#f8fafc), not pure white, to reduce eye strain.
Borders are mandatory for cards to define edges clearly (1px solid Slate-200).
Focus rings must be 4px wide and high contrast (Orange or Blue).

strategies: The 'Control Room' Grid for Dashboard: Dense, data-rich, but with clear borders.
The 'Floating Widget': High z-index, distinct shadow, clear separation from host site.

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise texture on dashboard backgrounds to reduce digital sterility.

media.icons: Use Lucide-React. Stroke width 2px for clarity. Size 20px or 24px.

accessibility_checklist.contrast: All text must meet WCAG AAA (7:1) where possible, AA (4.5:1) mandatory.
accessibility_checklist.aria: All interactive elements must have aria-labels if no text is present.

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. Create the 'Widget' as a standalone component that can be visually tested in the dashboard before export.
3. Use the 'Manrope' font for all headings. Import it from Google Fonts.
4. The Dashboard must look like a 'Cockpit' - high density, but organized with clear borders.
5. Do not use gradients for backgrounds. Use solid colors or subtle patterns.
6. Ensure the 'ASL Video Player' in the widget has large, clear play/pause controls.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. Avoid this.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) ONLY for the widget background.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
